metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Git Stash
Key Commands for Stashing
What is Git Stash? Why Use It?
Sometimes you need to quickly switch tasks or fix a bug, but you're not ready to commit your work.
content.html: Sometimes you need to quickly switch tasks or fix a bug, but you're not ready to commit your work.

content.text: git stash lets you save your uncommitted changes and return to a clean working directory.
content.html: git stash lets you save your uncommitted changes and return to a clean working directory.

content.text: You can come back and restore your changes later.
content.html: You can come back and restore your changes later.

content.text: Here are some common use cases:
content.html: Here are some common use cases:

content.text: Stash Your Changes ( git stash )
Save your current changes (both staged and unstaged tracked files) with:
content.html: Save your current changes (both staged and unstaged tracked files) with:

content.code:
git
stash
Saved working directory and index state WIP on main: 1234567 Add new feature
content.code_html:
git stash
Saved working directory and index state WIP on main: 1234567 Add new feature

content.text: This command saves your changes and cleans your working directory so you can safely switch tasks or branches.
content.html: This command saves your changes and cleans your working directory so you can safely switch tasks or branches.

content.text: Your changes are now saved in a stack.
content.html: Your changes are now saved in a stack.

content.text: What is a stash stack?
content.html: What is a stash stack?

content.text: Each time you run git stash , your changes are saved on top of a "stack".
content.html: Each time you run git stash, your changes are saved on top of a "stack".

content.text: The most recent stash is on top, and you can apply or drop stashes from the top down, or pick a specific one from the list.
content.html: The most recent stash is on top, and you can apply or drop stashes from the top down, or pick a specific one from the list.

content.text: Your working directory is clean, and you can switch branches or pull updates safely.
content.html: Your working directory is clean, and you can switch branches or pull updates safely.

content.text: Stash with a Message ( git stash push -m )
Add a message to remember what you stashed:
content.html: Add a message to remember what you stashed:

content.code:
git
stash push -m
"WIP: homepage redesign"

Saved working directory and index state On main: WIP: homepage redesign
content.code_html:
git stash push -m "WIP: homepage redesign"
Saved working directory and index state On main: WIP: homepage redesign

content.text: This command lets you add a descriptive message to your stash so you can remember what you were working on.
content.html: This command lets you add a descriptive message to your stash so you can remember what you were working on.

content.text: List All Stashes ( git stash list )
See all your saved stashes:
content.html: See all your saved stashes:

content.code:
git
stash list
stash@{0}: On main: WIP: homepage redesign
stash@{1}: WIP on main: 1234567 Add new feature
content.code_html:
git stash list
stash@{0}: On main: WIP: homepage redesign
stash@{1}: WIP on main: 1234567 Add new feature

content.text: This command shows all the stashes you have saved so far, with their names and messages.
content.html: This command shows all the stashes you have saved so far, with their names and messages.

content.text: Show Stash Details ( git stash show )
See what was changed in the latest stash:
content.html: See what was changed in the latest stash:

content.code:
git
stash show
src/index.html | 2 +-
1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)
content.code_html:
git stash show
 src/index.html | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

content.text: This command gives a summary of what files and changes are in your most recent stash.
content.html: This command gives a summary of what files and changes are in your most recent stash.

content.text: To see a full diff:
content.html: To see a full diff:

content.code:
git
stash show -p
diff --git a/src/index.html b/src/index.html
index 1234567..89abcde 100644
--- a/src/index.html
+++ b/src/index.html
@@ ...
content.code_html:
git stash show -p
diff --git a/src/index.html b/src/index.html
index 1234567..89abcde 100644
--- a/src/index.html
+++ b/src/index.html
@@ ...

content.text: This command shows the exact lines that were changed in your most recent stash.
content.html: This command shows the exact lines that were changed in your most recent stash.

content.text: Apply the Latest Stash ( git stash apply )
Restore your most recent stashed changes (keeps the stash in the stack):
content.html: Restore your most recent stashed changes (keeps the stash in the stack):

content.code:
git
stash apply
On branch main
Changes not staged for commit:
(use "git add
..." to update what will be committed)
(use "git restore
..." to discard changes in working directory)
modified:   src/index.html
content.code_html:
git stash apply
On branch main
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add ..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore ..." to discard changes in working directory)
    modified:   src/index.html

content.text: This command restores your most recent stashed changes, but keeps the stash in the list so you can use it again if needed.
content.html: This command restores your most recent stashed changes, but keeps the stash in the list so you can use it again if needed.

content.text: Apply a Specific Stash ( git stash apply stash@ { n } )
Restore a specific stash from the list:
content.html: Restore a specific stash from the list:

content.code:
git
stash apply stash@
{
1
}

On branch main
Changes not staged for commit:
modified:   src/index.html
content.code_html:
git stash apply stash@{1}
On branch main
Changes not staged for commit:
    modified:   src/index.html

content.text: This command lets you restore a specific stash from your list, not just the most recent one.
content.html: This command lets you restore a specific stash from your list, not just the most recent one.

content.text: Pop the Stash ( git stash pop )
Apply the latest stash and remove it from the stack :
content.html: Apply the latest stash and remove it from the stack:

content.code:
git
stash pop
On branch main
Changes not staged for commit:
modified:   src/index.html
Dropped refs/stash@{0} (abc1234d5678)
content.code_html:
git stash pop
On branch main
Changes not staged for commit:
    modified:   src/index.html
Dropped refs/stash@{0} (abc1234d5678)

content.text: This command restores your most recent stash and removes it from the list at the same time.
content.html: This command restores your most recent stash and removes it from the list at the same time.

content.text: Drop a Stash ( git stash drop )
Delete a specific stash when you no longer need it:
content.html: Delete a specific stash when you no longer need it:

content.code_html:
git stash drop stash@{0}
Dropped stash@{0} (abc1234d5678)

content.text: This command deletes a specific stash from your list when you no longer need it.
content.html: This command deletes a specific stash from your list when you no longer need it.

content.text: Clear All Stashes ( git stash clear )
Delete all your stashes at once:
content.html: Delete all your stashes at once:

content.code_html: git stash clear

content.text: This command deletes all your stashes at once. Be careful! This cannot be undone!
content.html: This command deletes all your stashes at once. Be careful! This cannot be undone!

content.text: Branch from a Stash ( git stash branch )
Create a new branch and apply a stash to it.
content.html: Create a new branch and apply a stash to it.

content.text: Useful if your stashed work should become its own feature branch:
content.html: Useful if your stashed work should become its own feature branch:

content.code:
git
stash branch new-feature stash@
{
0
}

Switched to a new branch 'new-feature'
On branch new-feature
Changes not staged for commit:
modified:   src/index.html
Dropped stash@{0} (abc1234d5678)
content.code_html:
git stash branch new-feature stash@{0}
Switched to a new branch 'new-feature'
On branch new-feature
Changes not staged for commit:
    modified:   src/index.html
Dropped stash@{0} (abc1234d5678)

content.text: This command creates a new branch and applies your stashed changes to it.
content.html: This command creates a new branch and applies your stashed changes to it.

content.text: This is useful if you decide your work should become its own feature branch.
content.html: This is useful if you decide your work should become its own feature branch.

content.text: Best Practices for Stashing
Troubleshooting
Note: Stashes are useful for temporary work, but are not a replacement for commits!
content.html: Note: Stashes are useful for temporary work, but are not a replacement for commits!

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
